clients.name: Foreign prize
clients.workload: 1 big and prestigious project per year.

clients.name: To the abyss
clients.workload: 200 to 1000 words per week, but we might get some bigger project too.

clients.name: Locust
clients.workload: 2-3 mid sized projects per year.

clients.name: Jupiter translations
clients.workload: 2k words every two weeks, usually. Sometimes we have bigger batches.

clients.name: Quizzatron
clients.workload: 2 to 3 mid-sized or bigger projects per year, average reputation.

clients.name: Glytch
clients.workload: Recurrent mini batches, 2k to 7k per month.

clients.name: Bassaliter
clients.workload: 2-3 medium or big projects per year, usually prestigious.

clients.name: Tigerviaduct
clients.workload: Constant flow, but projects can be messy. Also, you won't get any reputation from them.

clients.name: NekoArmy
clients.workload: Random workflow, no reputation gained from our projects.

clients.name: LeTitsNow
clients.workload: A couple of huge and prestigious projects per year.

clients.name: All the Woe
clients.workload: Constant flow of small batches.

clients.name: All the Delay
clients.workload: Big batches, completely random flow, no reputation gained.

clients.name: Fall the Way
clients.workload: 12 to 16k per month, without any notice. No reputation gained.

clients.name: Tabbyte
clients.workload: ~5.000 words per week. Projects have average prestige.

clients.name: Voxelspleen
clients.workload: 2 huge projects per year, great for visibility.

clients.name: Subatomic workshop
clients.workload: 4 to 7 medium tasks per year, random prestige.

clients.name: Thor
clients.workload: Constant flow, small batches, no disclosure on our tasks (0 reputation acquired).

clients.name: The worst place
clients.workload: Constant workflow of medium sized batches. ~20k words per month. 0 Prestige.

clients.name: The last resort
clients.workload: 2-3 huge projects per year. Sorry, no prestige acquired.

clients.name: Random Bottom feeder
clients.workload: Daily flow, ~5k per week. No prestige gained.

clients.name: Peanuts Payer
clients.workload: Daily flow, ~11k per week. Moderate prestige.

clients.name: Wyvern child
clients.workload: Variable workflow; frequent small batches or sporadic big ones. Good reputation.

clients.name: TranslateThat!
clients.workload: 1 huge project per year, great reputation.

clients.name: Monkey wordsmith
clients.workload: 4 big projects per year. Stellar reputation, if you get to disclose the game.

clients.name: MostlyOK
clients.workload: A bunch of medium sized projects, can also get a couple of major ones. Rare chance to get great reputation.

clients.name: Peacetrance
clients.workload: 1 huge project per year, average reputation.

clients.name: Quiworse
clients.workload: 6 to 7 medium sized projects per year. Low reputation.

clients.name: Trancepartial
clients.workload: Constant weekly flow around 9k words. Reputation? What's reputation?

clients.name: Purplesound
clients.workload: ~7k words per week. Reputation may vary.

clients.name: Leechtranslation
clients.workload: ~500 words per day. No prestigious projects, sorry.

clients.name: Loca-lies oblique
clients.workload: Random workload, random projects. Frequent small batches or sporadic bigger ones.

clients.name: Globalhard
clients.workload: 3 to 5 mid-sized or major projects per year, medium to great reputation.

clients.name: Defective
clients.workload: We can't foresee the workload, nor the projects' prestige. Sorry.

clients.name: SwordGuardian
clients.workload: 5 to 10 small to mid-sized projects per year, fair reputation.

clients.name: GoalToFail
clients.workload: Constant workflow, ~40k words per year. Random prestige.

clients.name: PostToLose
clients.workload: Constant workflow, ~50k per month. No prestige acquired.

clients.name: Beretta
clients.workload: Unpredictable workflow, but great reputation!

clients.name: RevolTrance
clients.workload: 2 massive tasks per year, good prestige.

clients.name: Fran’s late indirect
clients.workload: Constant flow of small and mid sized projects. No prestige acquired.

clients.name: AI Games
clients.workload: 1 massive project per year, great reputation.

clients.name: WanRoad
clients.workload: Constant flow of ~4k words per week. No reputation gained.

clients.name: WeLotOfLies
clients.workload: Average workload of 300 to 600 words per day. Sometimes you also get some reputation.

clients.name: ScreamTech
clients.workload: Unpredictable workflow, but reputation is decent.

clients.name: 人10$
clients.workload: 3 gorgeous projects per year. But no one will ever know you worked on them.

clients.name: Gramsci
clients.workload: Constant workflow, ~200 words per day, sometimes you can get some mid sized projects too. Reputation not available.

clients.name: Locagator
clients.workload: 5 to 10 mid sized projects per year, plus small batches from time to time. Fair prestige.

clients.name: Lemma Wolves
clients.workload: ~5 mid sized projects per year. Sometimes you get a bigger one too. Low chances of getting a good reputation.

clients.name: Botoro
clients.workload: ~9k words per week, no big projects, no reputation.

clients.name: TermBow
clients.workload: ~10 mid sized tasks per year, fair amount of reputation acquired for each task.

clients.name: Many Words Multi Lang
clients.custom_email:
HALLO! Please.
We give you many word.
You write word in you language for us.
Money arrive soon.

events.name: CLUMSY-FILHIMBOOSTIER
events.description: Your creative translations make you lose a client.

events.name: 0.05 + VAT
events.description: Your reputation doubles and you get more clients, but your money is halved for the whole run.

events.name: SCHOOL OF LOC
events.description: You earn 0.015 per word passively by exploiting your ex-students.

events.name: WORDY RAPPINGHOOD
events.description: Today you feel swag: you can process up to 10k words.

events.name: NIGHTMARE FUEL
events.description: Surprise, surprise: the text is in rhyme! So now you’ll spend twice the time.

events.name: FREE DRINKS AT THE SWISS BOOTH
events.description: +3 reputation, but for the next 10 seconds you are drunk (you see twice as many tasks, but only half of them are real).

events.name: MTPEEEEEW
events.description: The revision task was actually post-editing in disguise. You spend double time but get the same pay.

events.name: RESISTANCE IS FUTILE
events.description: A random client is suddenly acquired by Q-worse and from now it pays you -50%

events.name: TUTTY FUZZY
events.description: A new fuzzy grid just dropped, you earn -33% for the task.

events.name: WORKING AT BULL SPEED
events.description: Energy drinks boost your speed but take a toll on your health, increasing your chances of getting sick.

events.name: VARIABLE REX
events.description: You learn RegEx and your productivity goes up.

events.name: BENEVOLENT REX
events.description: Your colleague helps you with RegEx formulas, you get a productivity boost.

events.name: MORE THAN NATIVE
events.description: You type twice as fast.

events.name: I'VE SEEN THINGS YOU PEOPLE WOULDN’T BELIEVE
events.description: The client asked ChatGPT to check your text. You lose 30 minutes replying to useless comments.

events.name: ROCK THE CASTAH
events.description: You spend some time chatting with your close colleagues. Stress is partially restored.

events.name: CAT ON THE KEYBOARD
events.description: You write many words per minute, but quality is 100% random.

events.name: DOG DUTY
events.description: You earn nothing special, but recover mental health.

events.name: TRANSLATOR'S BEST FRIEND
events.description: You spend some time with your pet and recover some stress.

events.name: YOUR PARTNER IS A DEV
events.description: Your lovely partner creates your website. You save money, you gain reputation and recover some stress.

events.name: YOU WEREN’T WORKING, RIGHT?
events.description: Your mother keeps you on the phone for 30 minutes in the middle of a task.

events.name: NEED FOR SPID
events.description: Your mother needs assistance with bureaucracy and IT stuff. The 30 minutes become 1 hour.

events.name: PET TAX
events.description: You gain reputation by sending one client cute photos of your pet.

events.name: FAST AS LIGHTNING
events.description: You install fast fiber and your productivity goes up.

events.name: WORK FOR EXPOSURE
events.description: The client asks you to cut your rate for a very big and prestigious project. Stress and reputation go up. You earn less money.

events.name: CLOCKWORK ORANGE KEYBOARD
events.description: You boost your productivity for today, but waste time arguing with neighbors who knock on your door to complain about the noise.

events.name: MONEY MAKING MONEY TAKING
events.description: A payment of $X has not been paid for over two months. Do you want to pay $X to hire a lawyer to scare the client and get your payment in 3 months?

events.name: GHOSTIN’ & SHAMELESS
events.description: Without warning, one of your clients stops sending you tasks for an indefinite period.

events.name: SHEET, I’LL MISS MY DEADLINE!
events.description: The client’s responses to the query sheet have arrived, you need to implement them immediately. (-x minutes, no money)

events.name: HONEY, I SCRAMBLED THE KIT
events.description: The localization kit is completely disorganized, so you end up spending one and a half times more time.

events.name: MINIMUM FEE
events.description: One client agrees to pay you $10 for all tasks under $10.

events.name: CUT TOOL
events.description: Your localization tool’s server is down. You lose time and your stress increases.

events.name: WHAM! BAM! IT’S IN! THE SPAM!
events.description: The client’s email went to spam. You lose reputation for not replying. They’re definitely not enjoying what you do.

events.name: TOO MANY TOOLS WILL SPOIL THEM BOTH
events.description: You forgot to open Slack, Teams, Discord, Skype, whatnot. You lose reputation, and one client stops sending you tasks for two weeks.

events.name: NON DISCLOSURE DISAGREEMENT
events.description: The big client with the prestigious project didn’t include you in the credits. You can’t mention the game, and you don’t gain the promised reputation.

events.name: WEEKDAY HIGH FEVER
events.description: You have a fever. You can keep working and sacrifice your health, or you can rest and miss your deadlines.

events.name: THE GREEDS OF SEPARATION
events.description: You discover that one of your clients is also a client of another client of yours. You have to drop them due to a conflict of interest.

events.name: PONZI SCHEME
events.description: You can subcontract some tasks. You earn $X in a continuous stream, even while filling out invoices. Stress doesn’t increase, but the pay is meager. (decidere se aggiungere tasto “subappalta” ad alcuni task.

events.name: DID YOU TRY TURNING IT OFF AND ON?
events.description: Today your connection is acting up. You are forced to work from an internet café. Your productivity is halved.

events.name: Too comfy sweatpants
events.description: You forget how to dress properly, wearing your sweatpants even when going out or meeting colleagues. You lose reputation.

bonus.name: Health insurance
bonus.description: You don’t lose any money when you get sick.

bonus.name: Proper lighting
bonus.description: Quality increases, monthly bills are slightly reduced.

bonus.name: Cat
bonus.description: Stress reduced, reputation increased. Occasionally affects negatively quality and time spent. (malus: ogni tanto ti fa perdere tempo o qualità)

bonus.name: Gym membership
bonus.description: Less chances to get sick, productivity increases.

bonus.name: Coffee machine
bonus.description: Productivity boost, quality increases. Stress is also increased.

bonus.name: High speed fiber
bonus.description: Productivity is increased, stress is reduced. Has also a monthly cost.

bonus.name: CAT tool
bonus.description: Productivity, quality and reputation are increased. Has also a monthly cost.

bonus.name: Standing desk
bonus.description: Productivity is reduced. Less chances to get sick.

bonus.name: Heated socks
bonus.description: Monthly bills are slightly reduced, less chances to get sick.

bonus.name: Noise cancelling headphones
bonus.description: Stress is reduced, productivity is increased.

bonus.name: Wrist-rest for keyboard
bonus.description: Stress is reduced. Productivity and quality are increased.

bonus.name: Organized desk
bonus.description: Stress is reduced, productivity is increased. (only temporary)
